Condition.</span></td></tr></table></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="-sec-extract:summary;text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">On July 23, 2024, Philip Morris International Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) issued a press release announcing its financial results for the second quarter and the first half-year ended June 30, 2024, as well as the accompanying glossary of key terms, definitions, explanatory notes, select financial information and reconciliations of non-GAAP financial measures. The earnings release is attached as Exhibit 99.1 to this Current Report on Form 8-K and incorporated by reference to this Item 2.02. The glossary of key terms, definitions, explanatory notes, select financial information and reconciliations of non-GAAP financial measures is attached as Exhibit 99.2 to this Current Report on Form 8-K and incorporated by reference to this Item 2.02.</span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span style="color:#000000;font-family:'Times New Roman',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">In accordance with General Instruction B.2 of Form 8-K, the information in Item 2.02 of this Current Report on Form 8-K, including Exhibits 99.1 and 99.2, shall not be deemed &#8220;filed&#8221; for the purposes of Section 18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, or otherwise subject to the liabilities of that section. The information in Item 2.02 of this Current Report on Form 8-K shall not be incorporated by reference into any filing or other document pursuant to the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, except as may be expressly set forth by specific reference in such filing or document.</span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="text-align:justify"><span><br/></span></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;text-align:justify"><table and grew by 10.6% excluding currency</font></div><div style="text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_7"></div><div style="text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_10"></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">STAMFORD, CT, July 23, 2024 &#8211; Philip Morris International Inc. (PMI) (NYSE&#58; PM) today announces its 2024 second-quarter and first-half results.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-3.5pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_16"></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:7.2pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;The excellent momentum of our smoke-free business continued with an outstanding second-quarter and<br>first-half performance&#34;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> said Jacek Olczak, Chief Executive Officer.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:7.2pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8220;The powerful combination of excellent underlying performance and proactive measures across all categories enabled our business to outperform once again, and we are on track for a strong 2024. As a result, we are raising our full-year guidance, despite currency headwinds.&#8221;</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_19"></div><div style="text-align:center"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:99.729%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:98.900%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;border-top:1.5pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:center;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Second Quarter Highlights</font></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:7.2pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-7.2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;padding-left:3.7pt">Smoke-free business (SFB)&#58;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> The smoke-free business accounted for 38.1% of our total net revenues (up by 2.7pp versus second-quarter last year), with 36.5 million estimated adult users of our smoke-free products (up by 3.2 million versus December 2023), which are available in 90 markets. Our SFB continues to deliver superior performance, with net revenues increasing by 13.6% (18.3% organically) and gross profit increasing by 15.6% (22.2% organically).</font></div><div style="padding-left:7.2pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-7.2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;padding-left:3pt">Inhalable smoke-free products (SFP)&#58; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Total </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> users at quarter-end were estimated at 30.8 million (up by 1.9 million versus December 2023), of which approximately 22.1 million had fully switched to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and stopped smoking. The increase was broad-based, with notable gains in Japan following the launch of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ILUMA i</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, as well as good progress in Europe (especially Greece, Hungary, Romania, Bulgaria, and Spain), South Korea, and low and middle income markets, notably Indonesia. Market share for HTUs in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> markets was up by 0.7pp to 8.1%. HTU adjusted in-market sales (IMS) volume, which excludes the net impact of estimated distributor and wholesaler inventory movements was up by an estimated 10.2%, in line with expectations.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:21.6pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-7.2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:3.7pt">In Japan, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> HTU market share increased by more than 3 percentage points to over 29%, and offtake share exceeded 30% for the first time in June. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">TEREA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">SENTIA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> were the #1 and #3 nicotine brands respectively in the quarter. Adjusted IMS grew by 12.5%, the 7</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.5pt;vertical-align:baseline">th</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> consecutive quarter of double-digit growth.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:21.6pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-7.2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:3.7pt">In Europe, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> HTU adjusted market share increased by 0.8pp to 9.8% with adjusted IMS growth of 6.8%, which, as expected, was impacted by the EU characterizing flavor ban, especially in Italy. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:7.2pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In the vaping category, our focused strategy is showing promising early results, with </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">VEEV </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">taking the #1 position in the closed pod segment in 5 European markets within 12 months of launch.</font></div><div style="border-bottom:1pt solid black;margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;width:150pt"></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:150%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">1</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:150%"> Explanation of PMI's use of non-GAAP measures cited in this document and reconciliations to the most directly comparable U.S. GAAP measures can be found in the &#8220;Non-GAAP Measures, Glossary and Explanatory Notes&#8221; section of this release, in Exhibit 99.2 to the company's Form 8-K dated July 23, 2024, and at </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:150%;text-decoration:underline">www.pmi.com&#47;2024Q2earnings</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:150%">.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:7.2pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-7.2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;padding-left:3.7pt">Oral SFP</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:6.5pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;position:relative;top:-3.5pt;vertical-align:baseline">2</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#58; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Shipment volume increased by 23.5% in cans (20.0% in pouches or pouch equivalents), fueled by </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ZYN</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> nicotine pouch growth in the U.S., where shipments reached 135.1 million cans, representing growth of 50.3% versus prior year. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ZYN</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, despite supply constraints, performed in-line with the U.S. nicotine pouch category in terms of consumer offtake. Outside of the U.S., our nicotine pouch volume grew by over 50% with promising results in a number of new markets, notably Pakistan.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:7.2pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-7.2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;padding-left:3.7pt">Combustibles&#58;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> Net revenues grew by 1.2% (organically by 4.8%), driven by another quarter of high single-digit pricing and resilient industry volumes. After 7 consecutive quarters of gross margin contraction, profitability recovered in Q2 with very robust expansion of 40 bps (50 bps on an organic basis), primarily driven by pricing.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:3pt;padding-left:7.2pt;text-indent:-7.2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%;padding-left:3.7pt">Dividend&#58; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">We declared a regular quarterly dividend of $1.30 per share, or an annualized $5.20 per share.</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_22"></div><div><table style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Reported diluted EPS is forecast to be in a range of $5.89 to $6.01, at prevailing exchange rates, versus reported diluted EPS of $5.02 in 2023. Excluding a total 2024 adjustment of $0.44 per share, this forecast represents a projected increase of 5.3% to 7.3% versus adjusted diluted EPS of $ 6.01 in 2023. Also excluding an adverse currency impact of $0.34, at prevailing exchange rates, this forecast represents a projected increase of 11.0% to 13.0% versus adjusted diluted EPS of $6.01 in 2023, as outlined in the above table.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">2024 Full-Year Forecast Assumptions</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">This forecast assumes&#58;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">A broadly stable total international industry volume for cigarettes and HTUs, excluding China and the U.S.&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Total cigarette, HTU and oral smoke-free product shipment volume growth for PMI of 1% to 2% driven by smoke-free products&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">A second half acceleration in HTU adjusted IMS to deliver around 13% growth for the full year, and HTU shipment volumes of around 140 billion units. This assumes no volumes in Taiwan and a slightly greater impact from consumer adjustment to the EU characterizing flavor ban than previously assumed&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font compared to 2023&#59;</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font exchange rates as we continue to target a ratio of around 2x by the end of 2026&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font roundings.</font></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:1pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Second-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:1pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume increased by 2.5% (HTU shipments increased by 13.1%, and cigarette shipments increased by 0.4%), with increases across all regions except the Americas.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI&#8217;s total oral product shipment volume in cans increased by 23.5%, predominantly reflecting growth in nicotine pouches.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted in-market sales for HTUs increased by 10.2%, including growth in Japan of 12.5% and Europe of 6.8%.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Six Months Year-to-Date</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:1pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume increased by 2.8% (HTU shipments increased by 16.8%, while cigarette shipments were stable).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI&#8217;s total oral product shipment volume in cans increased by 31.2%, primarily reflecting growth in nicotine pouches.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted in-market sales for HTUs increased by 11.4%, including growth in Japan of 12.9% and Europe of 8.0%. A net favorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements for HTU shipments was driven most significantly by additional shipments to Japan in light of disruption to Red Sea shipping routes.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 5 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 9.6% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, primarily due to higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; and favorable volume&#47;mix, driven by higher smoke-free products volume.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 12.5% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; the favorable pricing variance&#59; and favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by smoke-free products volume, notwithstanding style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted net revenues increased by 10.2% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, primarily driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; and favorable volume&#47;mix, driven by higher smoke-free products volume, partly offset by unfavorable cigarette mix.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 17.0% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; the favorable pricing variance, predominantly driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; and favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher smoke-free products volume&#59; partly offset by higher marketing, administration and research costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts, notably related to wages, and higher commercial investments), as well as </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 7 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts, notably related to tobacco leaf and the impact of the EU single-use plastics directive, partly offset by productivity).</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_64"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:20pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">EUROPE REGION</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_67"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Second-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region decreased by 1.7% to 138.0 billion units, reflecting a 2.8% decline for cigarettes, partly offset by an increase for HTUs. The decrease in the estimated total market was predominantly due to France (down by 11.4%), the UK (down by 15.4%), Germany (down by 3.3%), and the Netherlands (down by 20.7%), partly offset by Bulgaria (up by 10.6%), Romania (up by 5.0%), and Greece (up by 8.3%).</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:1pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Six Months Year-to-Date</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region decreased by 1.2% to 262.1 billion units, reflecting a 2.6% decline for cigarettes, partly offset by an increase for HTUs. The decrease in the estimated total market was predominantly due to France (down by 13.8%), the UK (down by 13.3%), and the Netherlands (down by 15.5%), partly offset by Bulgaria (up by 9.7%), Poland (up by 2.3%), Romania (up by 3.9%), and Greece (up by 7.1%).</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><table style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 8 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Second-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region increased by 1.7% to 56.4 billion units. Total cigarette and HTU shipment volume increased notably in Italy (up by 7.6%), mainly driven by cigarettes, and Poland (up by 6.0%), and decreased notably in France (down by 11.7%) and the Netherlands (down by 19.5%), both driven by cigarettes.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume in the Region increased by 6.8% in the quarter, reflecting continued growth momentum for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, partly offset by the impact from the EU characterizing flavor ban.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's HTU share of the total cigarette and HTU market in the Region increased by 0.8 points on an adjusted basis.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Oral SFP shipments decreased by 1.6% with decline of snus (down by 5.6%), partly offset by nicotine pouches (up by 26.9%).</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Six Months Year-to-Date</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region increased by 0.1% to 104.8 billion units. Total cigarette and HTU shipment volume increased notably in Poland (up by 7.9%), Greece (up by 9.6%), and Germany (up by 1.9%), and decreased notably in France (down by 21.7%) and the Netherlands (down by 15.2%), both driven by cigarettes.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume in the Region increased by 8.0%, reflecting continued growth momentum for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, partly offset by the impact from the EU characterizing flavor ban.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's HTU share of the total cigarette and HTU market in the Region increased by 0.9 points on an adjusted basis.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Oral SFP shipments increased by 6.9%, driven by growth of nicotine pouches (up by 40.2%) and snus (up by 2.5%).</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_73"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Financial Summary</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Second-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:507.75pt"><tr><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:127.75pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="width:1.75pt"></td><td style="width:1.0pt"></td><td style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 7.1% on an organic basis, primarily driven by the same factors as for the quarter.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 9.9% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, mainly driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; and favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by higher HTU volume, notwithstanding lower cigarette volume&#59; partly offset by higher marketing, administration and research costs as well as manufacturing costs, including the impact of the EU single-use plastics directive.</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_79"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:20pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">SSEA, CIS &#38; MEA REGION</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_82"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Second-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region increased by 3.7% to 393.9 billion units. The increase in the estimated total market was mainly due to Russia (up by 6.2%), Pakistan (up by 42.4%), Egypt (up by 18.6%), Bangladesh (up by 8.5%), and Turkey (up by 4.1%), partly offset by Thailand (down by 19.5%) and Kazakhstan (down by 8.8%).</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Six Months Year-to-Date</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region increased by 2.5% to 767.0 billion units. The increase in the estimated total market was mainly due to Turkey (up by 10.3%), Russia (up by 5.3%), Indonesia (up by 3.1%), and Bangladesh (up by 6.5%), partly offset by Thailand (down by 14.1%) and Philippines (down by 7.9%).</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Second-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region increased by 4.5% to 94.3 billion units, mainly driven by Turkey (up by 9.7%) and Saudi Arabia (up by 68.9% due to inventory movements), partly offset by Indonesia (down by 6.4%), Thailand (down by 24.9%) and the Philippines (down by 9.7%). PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume increased by 11.4%, with 18.5% HTU shipment volume growth. HTU shipment growth in Russia primarily reflects timing and cross-border dynamics, with limited underlying growth.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Six Months Year-to-Date</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region increased by 4.8% to 180.6 billion units, mainly driven by Turkey (up by 16.0%), partly offset by the Philippines (down by 14.2%). PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume increased by 13.1%, with 15.2% HTU shipment volume growth.</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_88"></div><div mix.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 25.9% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, mainly driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; and favorable volume&#47;mix, driven by higher smoke-free products and cigarettes volume, notwithstanding unfavorable cigarette mix&#59; partly offset by higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to higher cost of tobacco leaf).</font></div><div 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(1) Termination of distribution arrangement in the Middle East.</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="42" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(2) See Schedule 11 in Exhibit 99.2 to the Form 8-K dated July 23, 2024, for additional detail.</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted net revenues increased by 12.4% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, mainly driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; and favorable volume&#47;mix, driven by higher cigarette and HTU volume and favorable cigarettes mix.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 22.8% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, mainly driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing&#59; and favorable volume&#47;mix, driven by higher cigarette and HTU volume, notwithstanding unfavorable cigarette mix&#59; partly offset by higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to higher cost of tobacco leaf).</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_94"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:20pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">EA, AU AND PMI DF REGION</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_97"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Second-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region, excluding China, decreased by 0.7% to 80.2 billion units, with a decline in cigarettes, partly offset by HTU growth. The decrease in the estimated total market was mainly driven by Australia (down by 29.1%), South Korea (down by 1.9%), and Taiwan (down by 4.2%), partly offset by International Duty Free (up by 8.5%) and Japan (up by 0.9%).</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Six Months Year-to-Date</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region, excluding China, was stable at 156.0 billion units, with HTU growth partly offset by a decline in cigarettes. The increase in the estimated total market was mainly driven by International Duty Free (up by 12.4%) and Japan (up by 1.0%), partly offset by Australia (down by 29.4%).</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region increased by 1.0% to 27.3 billion units, driven by Japan (up by 5.0%), partly offset by Australia (down by 28.5%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume in the Region increased by 13.3% in the quarter, including growth in Japan of 12.5%.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font shipment volume in the Region increased by 5.0% to 54.5 billion units, driven by Japan (up by 12.6%), partly offset by Australia (down by 27.2%).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's estimated HTU adjusted in-market sales volume style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 12.1% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance and favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher HTU volume, partly offset by lower cigarette volume.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 22.1% on an organic basis, primarily driven by the same factors as for net revenues.</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_109"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:20pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">AMERICAS REGION</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_112"></div><div style="margin-top:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Second-Quarter</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region, excluding the U.S., decreased by 2.7% to 45.2 billion units, primarily reflecting a decline for cigarettes. The decrease in the estimated total market was mainly due to Argentina (down by 20.0%) and Canada (down by 12.6%), partly offset by Brazil (up by 9.6%).</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Six Months Year-to-Date</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:13pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The estimated total market for cigarettes and HTUs in the Region, excluding the U.S., decreased by 2.8% to 89.9 billion units, primarily reflecting a decline for cigarettes. The decrease in the estimated total market was mainly due to Argentina (down by 13.8%) and Canada (down by 12.9%), partly offset by Brazil (up by 6.5%).</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region decreased by 3.6% to 15.1 billion units, mainly due to Argentina (down by 19.9%), partly offset by Brazil (up by 8.7%).</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Oral products shipments increased style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Six Months Year-to-Date</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total cigarette and HTU shipment volume in the Region decreased by 3.7% to 29.5 billion units, mainly due to Argentina (down by 14.7%), partly offset by Brazil (up by 9.4%).</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Cigar shipment volume declined by 18.3%, predominantly due to a tough comparison related to trade inventory movements in the prior-year around the April 2023 price increase. Gross profit grew robustly.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Oral products shipments increased by 43.4%, driven by </font><font style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 14.2% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to the growth of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ZYN</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> nicotine pouches in the U.S., partly offset by lower cigarette volume and unfavorable cigarette mix outside of the U.S.&#59; and favorable pricing variance, predominantly driven by higher combustible tobacco pricing.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 15 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 8.7% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix and price variance, mainly due to the same factors as for net revenues&#59; partly offset by higher marketing and administration costs, including incremental investment in the U.S.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Six Months style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">&#8212;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"></td><td colspan="2" style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">20</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"></td></tr><tr style="height:5pt"><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 Margin</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="2" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">(18.8)</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">%</font></td><td colspan="2" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">(38.3)</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">%</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">19.5pp</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">18.1pp</font></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td></tr><tr style="height:5pt"><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="42" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(1) See Schedule 11 in Exhibit 99.2 to the Form 8-K dated July 23, 2024, for additional detail.</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 3.7% on an organic basis. The adjusted operating loss of $32 million was primarily due to R&#38;D and administration costs.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_133"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Philip Morris International&#58; Delivering a Smoke-Free Future</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Philip Morris International (PMI) is a leading international tobacco company, actively delivering a smoke-free future and evolving its portfolio for the long term to include products outside of the tobacco and nicotine sector. The company&#8217;s current product portfolio primarily consists of cigarettes and smoke-free products. Since 2008, PMI has invested over $12.5 billion to develop, scientifically substantiate and commercialize innovative smoke-free products for adults who would otherwise continue to smoke, with the goal of completely ending the sale of cigarettes. This includes the building of world-class scientific assessment capabilities, notably in the areas of pre-clinical systems toxicology, clinical and behavioral research, as well as post-market studies. In 2022, PMI acquired Swedish Match &#8211; a leader in oral nicotine delivery &#8211; creating a global smoke-free champion led by the companies&#8217; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ZYN</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> brands. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has authorized versions of PMI&#8217;s </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> devices and consumables and Swedish Match&#8217;s </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">General</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> snus as Modified Risk Tobacco Products and renewal applications for these products are presently pending before the FDA. As of June 30, 2024, PMI's smoke-free products were available for sale in 90 markets, and PMI estimates that 36.5 million adults around the world use PMI's smoke-free products. Smoke-free business accounted for approximately 38% of PMI&#8217;s total first-half 2024 net revenues. With a strong foundation and significant expertise in life sciences, PMI announced in February 2021 its ambition to expand into wellness and healthcare areas and, through its Vectura Fertin Pharma business, aims to enhance life through the delivery of seamless health experiences. For more information, please visit </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">www.pmi.com</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">www.pmiscience.com</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 17 -</font></div></div></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_136"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Forward-Looking and Cautionary Statements</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">This press release contains projections of future results and goals and other forward-looking statements, including statements regarding expected financial or operational performance&#59; capital allocation plans&#59; investment strategies&#59; regulatory outcomes&#59; market expectations&#59; and business plans and strategies. Achievement of future results is subject to risks, uncertainties and inaccurate assumptions. In the event that risks or uncertainties materialize, or underlying assumptions prove inaccurate, actual results could vary materially from those contained in such forward-looking statements. Pursuant to the &#8220;safe harbor&#8221; provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, PMI is identifying important factors that, individually or in the aggregate, could cause actual results and outcomes to differ materially from those contained in any forward-looking statements made by PMI.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's business risks include&#58; excise tax increases and discriminatory tax structures&#59; increasing marketing and regulatory restrictions that could reduce our competitiveness, eliminate our ability to communicate with adult consumers, or ban certain of our products in certain markets or countries&#59; health concerns relating to the use of tobacco and other nicotine-containing products and exposure to environmental tobacco smoke&#59; litigation related to tobacco and&#47;or nicotine use and intellectual property&#59; intense competition&#59; the effects of global and individual country economic, regulatory and political developments, natural disasters and conflicts&#59; the impact and consequences of Russia's invasion of Ukraine&#59; changes in adult smoker behavior&#59; the impact of natural disasters and pandemics on PMI's business&#59; lost revenues as a result of counterfeiting, contraband and cross-border purchases&#59; governmental investigations&#59; unfavorable currency exchange rates and currency devaluations, and limitations on the ability to repatriate funds&#59; adverse changes in applicable corporate tax laws&#59; adverse changes in the cost, availability, and quality of tobacco and other agricultural products and raw materials, as well as components and materials for our electronic devices&#59; and the integrity of its information systems and effectiveness of its data privacy policies. PMI's future profitability may also be adversely affected should it be unsuccessful in its attempts to introduce, commercialize, and grow smoke-free products or if regulation or taxation do not differentiate between such products and cigarettes&#59; if it is unable to successfully introduce new products, promote brand equity, enter new markets or improve its margins through increased prices and productivity gains&#59; if it is unable to expand its brand portfolio internally or through acquisitions and the development of strategic business relationships&#59; if it is unable to attract and retain the best global talent, including women or diverse candidates&#59; or if it is unable to successfully integrate and realize the expected benefits from recent transactions and acquisitions. Future results are also subject to the lower predictability of our smoke-free products performance.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI is further subject to other risks detailed from time to time in its publicly filed documents, including PMI's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2023, and the Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the second quarter ended June 30, 2024, which will be filed in the coming days. PMI cautions that the foregoing list of important factors is not a complete discussion of all potential risks and uncertainties. PMI does not undertake to update any forward-looking statement that it may make from time to time, except in the normal course of its public disclosure obligations.</font></div><div id="idb555fb7f38e476f8f2490d4f9289064_139"></div><div style="margin-bottom:5pt;margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Non-GAAP Measures, Glossary and Explanatory Notes</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Reconciliations of non-GAAP measures in this release to the most directly comparable U.S. GAAP measures can be found in Exhibit 99.2 to the Form 8-K dated July 23, 2024, and at </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">www.pmi.com&#47;2024Q2earnings</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">. A glossary of key terms, definitions and explanatory notes is available in the aforementioned Exhibit 99.2 and on </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 18 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">the same webpage, where additional financial schedules, as well as adjustments and other calculations have also been made available.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Management reviews net revenues, gross profit, operating income, operating income margin, operating cash flow and earnings per share, or &#34;EPS,&#34; on an adjusted basis, which may exclude the impact of currency and other items such as acquisitions, asset impairment and exit costs, tax items and other special items. Additionally, starting in 2022 and on a comparative basis, for these measures other than net revenues and operating cash flow, PMI includes adjustments to add back amortization expense on acquisition related intangible assets that are recorded as part of purchase accounting and contribute to PMI&#8217;s revenue generation, as well as impairment of intangible assets, if any. While amortization expense on acquisition related intangible assets is excluded in these adjusted measures, the net revenues generated from these acquired intangible assets are included in the company's adjusted measures, unless otherwise stated. Currency-neutral and organic growth rates reflect the way management views underlying performance for these measures. PMI believes that such measures provide useful insight into underlying business trends and results. Management reviews these measures because they exclude changes in currency exchange rates and other factors that may distort underlying business trends, thereby improving the comparability of PMI&#8217;s business performance between reporting periods. Furthermore, PMI uses several of these measures in its management compensation program to promote internal fairness and a disciplined assessment of performance against company targets. PMI discloses these measures to enable investors to view the business through the eyes of management.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Non-GAAP measures used in this release should neither be considered in isolation nor as a substitute for the financial measures prepared in accordance with U.S. GAAP.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">0.1&#160;</font></td><td style="border-top:1pt solid #acacac;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"></td><td colspan="2" style="border-top:1pt solid #acacac;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">0.1&#160;</font></td><td style="border-top:1pt solid #acacac;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"></td><td colspan="2" style="border-top:1pt solid #acacac;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">78.4&#160;</font></td><td style="border-top:1pt solid #acacac;padding:2px 1pt 2px solid #acacac;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"></td><td colspan="2" style="border-top:1pt solid #acacac;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">61.9&#160;</font></td><td style="border-top:1pt solid #acacac;padding:2px 1pt 2px stated</font></td></tr><tr style="height:12pt"><td colspan="78" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><font International Inc.</font></div><div style="text-align:center"><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:center"><font
